elements.title: Sarah Fischer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that soprano Sarah Fischer (pictured) sang excerpts from the title role in Carmen for the very first televised BBC broadcast of opera music?

elements.title: Life After Beth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jeff Baena made his characters Jewish in Life After Beth because he thought that Jews would be more likely to come back as zombies?

elements.title: Dorothy Sproule (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dorothy Sproule received letters from five British monarchs, earning her the title "Canadian Poet-Laureate to Royalty"?

elements.title: Jiaoyu zazhi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the publication of the magazine Jiaoyu zazhi was interrupted when the Japanese army bombed its publisher's headquarters?

elements.title: Dries Van Langendonck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dries Van Langendonck has been called "the great Belgian [Formula One] hope"?

elements.title: Infantino Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Infantino Street", an episode of The Flash, was named after a writer from the Silver Age of Comic Books?

elements.title: Yoetikno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, after Yoetikno's death, his family had local villagers keep a 24-hour watch over his grave in fear of graverobbers?

elements.title: Pringle House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the owner of Pringle House planned on vacating due to the risk of earthquake damage, but an earthquake damaged the building first?

elements.title: an AI system (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albanian prime minister Edi Rama determined that an AI system should become a cabinet minister tasked with ending corruption in public tenders?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Parahyangan

The West Javanese region centred around Java's third largest city of Bandung is an excellent place to hike and admire active volcanoes.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
